Feel free to skip if you have a technical background.

modules.title: Account setup
modules.description: Create and customize your Cloudflare account.

pages.additional_description: If you plan on using the Cloudflare API to manage various account settings, you should also create an API token associated with your account.

modules.title: Add a domain
modules.description: Make a few updates at your registrar and within Cloudflare to improve your domain's [speed, security, and reliability](/fundamentals/get-started/concepts/how-cloudflare-works/#benefits).

pages.additional_description: If your domain is particularly sensitive to downtime, you may want to do a bit of pre-work before adding it to Cloudflare.

If you control your [origin server](https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/cdn/glossary/origin-server/) and plan on using [Cloudflare’s proxy](/dns/manage-dns-records/reference/proxied-dns-records/), review your server configuration to avoid accidentally blocking Cloudflare IP addresses.
**Note**: If do not already have a domain name, start with [Cloudflare Registrar](/registrar/get-started/register-domain/) instead.

modules.title: Domain resolution
modules.description: After your domain is active on Cloudflare, review your DNS settings to make sure visitors can access your site.

pages.additional_description: Though Cloudflare automatically scans for DNS records, you should review your records to avoid unexpected issues.
Make sure you understand Cloudflare's proxy status, which affects how Cloudflare treats incoming traffic to a DNS record.

title: Secure your application
description: Learn more about the tools Cloudflare offers to protect your website against malicious traffic and bad actors.

modules.title: Concepts
modules.description:
Learn the fundamentals of website security.

Feel free to skip if you have a technical background.

modules.title: Account security
modules.description: Make sure your Cloudflare account is protected from takeover or compromise

modules.title: General security — Minimal setup
modules.description: Take a few simple steps to make sure your application is protected from a broad array of threats.

pages.link_title: Set up your Web Application Firewall (WAF)
pages.additional_description: For customers on a **Pro** plan or above, Cloudflare offers several [Managed Rulesets](/waf/managed-rulesets/) as part of the Web Application Firewall (WAF).

As long as your traffic is [proxied by Cloudflare](/fundamentals/get-started/concepts/how-cloudflare-works/), Cloudflare automatically protects your application from [DDoS attacks](/ddos-protection/).
Our Security Center scans your application to identify potential security risks and provide recommended next steps.

modules.title: Customize Web Application Firewall (WAF)
modules.description: Use a variety of rules to customize the behavior of your application's firewall. This step may require [detailed analysis](/waf/analytics/) of your application traffic.

pages.additional_description: Skip the execution of WAF Managed Rulesets or some of their rules.
Block, challenge, or allow requests based on [several characteristics](/ruleset-engine/rules-language/fields/) (user agents, cookies, referrer, and more).
Define rate limits for requests matching an expression and the action to perform when those rate limits are reached.
Block, challenge, or allow requests based on IP address, IP range, country, or ASN.
Block or challenge specific requests based on the associated user agent value.
For customers on a **Pro** plan or higher, specify a list of IP addresses, CIDR ranges, or networks that are allowed to access a particular domain, subdomain, or URL.

modules.title: Customize other security settings
modules.description: Update various settings to further refine how your application processes incoming traffic. This step may require [detailed analysis](/waf/analytics/) of your application traffic.

pages.additional_description: There are some nuances to how bot protection works, so you may want to [review our plans pages](/bots/plans/) before enabling.
Use the IP reputation of a visitor to determine whether to present a [Managed Challenge](/fundamentals/get-started/concepts/cloudflare-challenges/#managed-challenge) page.
Specify the length of time that a visitor can access your website after completing a security challenge.
Reduce the number of challenges presented to visitors using the **Privacy Pass** browser extension.
Browser Integrity Check evaluates incoming HTTP headers based on known threats — such as requests with a missing or non-standard user agent — and present a challenge page if needed.
Prevent access to specific URLs, request schemes, file types, subdomains, or directories by redirecting users to a safe location.
Restrict access to documents, files, and media.

pages.link_title: Learn about I'm Under Attack Mode
pages.additional_description: I'm Under Attack Mode performs additional security checks to help mitigate Layer 7 DDoS attacks. This feature should be used as a last resort when your application is under attack.

modules.title: Explore dedicated security products
modules.description: Cloudflare offers several dedicated products to increase the security of your website and underlying infrastructure.

pages.additional_description: Monitor third-party scripts on your application and receive notifications when they have been compromised or are exhibiting malicious behavior.
Protect your API from malicious traffic by enforcing schema validation, detecting abuse patterns, and more.
Use Cloudflare’s firewall-as-a-service (FWaaS) to protect office networks and cloud infrastructure with advanced, scalable protection.
Delivers network functions at Cloudflare scale — DDoS protection, traffic acceleration, and much more from every Cloudflare data center — for on-premise, cloud-hosted, and hybrid networks.

Securely connect any traffic source - data centers, offices, devices, cloud properties - to Cloudflare’s network and configure routing policies to get the bits where they need to go, all within one SaaS solution.
